subject: Sexual Health
title: Disability and Sexual Expression
description: A short lesson to help you apply Disability and Sexual Expression.

hook.text: People with disabilities are sexual beings with the same desires and rights as everyone else, yet society ignores this.

buildup.text: Physical disabilities may require adaptation but do not eliminate the capacity for pleasure and intimacy.

discovery.text: Research shows creative adaptation leads to deeply satisfying sexual experiences for people with diverse abilities.

twist.text: The biggest barrier is not the disability itself but societal attitudes that desexualize disabled people.

climax.text: Inclusive sexual health education and accessible resources empower everyone to enjoy fulfilling intimate lives.

punchline.text: Disability changes the method, not the right to pleasure.

quiz.question: What is the biggest barrier to sexual expression for disabled people?
